hu.elte.txtuml.api

Class Action

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.elte.txtuml.api.Action
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Model

    public abstract class Action
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModelElement
    Class Action provides methods for the user to be used as statements of the action language of the model.

    Represents: no model element directly, static methods are part of the action language

    Usage:

    Call its static methods from any method of the model where action language should be used.

    Java restrictions:

    • Instantiate: disallowed
    • Define subtype: disallowed

    See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

    Author:
    Gabor Ferenc Kovacs

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static <T extends ModelClass> T create(java.lang.Class<T> classType,
                                              ModelValue... parameters)
        Creates a new instance of the specified model class. Shows an error message if the creation failed for any reason.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the new model object
        Parameters:
        classType - the model class for which a new instance is to be created
        parameters - parameters of the new object
        Returns:
        a new instance of classType or null if the creation failed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if classType is null

      • delete

        public static void delete(ModelClass obj)
        Deletes the specified model object. Might only be called if all associations of the specified model object are already unlinked. Shows an error otherwise.

        See DELETED status of model objects for more information about model object deletion.

        Parameters:
        obj - the model object to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if obj is null

      • link

        public static <L extends ModelClass,R extends ModelClass> void link(java.lang.Class<? extends AssociationEnd<L>> leftEnd,
                                                                    L leftObj,
                                                                    java.lang.Class<? extends AssociationEnd<R>> rightEnd,
                                                                    R rightObj)
        Links two model objects through the specified association. Shows an error message if either parameter is in DELETED status. Has no effect if the specified association is already linked between the two objects.

        The two specified ends must be the two different ends of the same transition. None of the parameters should be null.

        Type Parameters:
        L - the type of objects on the left end of the association
        R - the type of objects on the right end of the association
        Parameters:
        leftEnd - the left end of the association
        leftObj - the object at the left end of the association
        rightEnd - right end of the association
        rightObj - the object at the right end of the association
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either leftEnd or rightEnd is null
        See Also:
        Association, AssociationEnd, ModelClass.Status.DELETED

      • unlink

        public static <L extends ModelClass,R extends ModelClass> void unlink(java.lang.Class<? extends AssociationEnd<L>> leftEnd,
                                                                      L leftObj,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<? extends AssociationEnd<R>> rightEnd,
                                                                      R rightObj)
        Unlinks two model objects through the specified association. Shows an error message if either parameter is in DELETED status. If the specified association is already unlinked (or was never linked) between the two objects, this method shows a warning.

        The two specified ends must be the two different ends of the same transition. None of the parameters should be null.

        Type Parameters:
        L - the type of objects on the left end of the association
        R - the type of objects on the right end of the association
        Parameters:
        leftEnd - the left end of the association
        leftObj - the object at the left end of the association
        rightEnd - right end of the association
        rightObj - the object at the right end of the association
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either leftEnd or rightEnd is null
        See Also:
        Association, AssociationEnd

      • start

        public static void start(ModelClass obj)
        Starts the state machine of the specified model object. Shows an error message if the parameter is in DELETED status.
        Parameters:
        obj - the model object which's state machine has to be started
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if obj is null

      • send

        public static void send(ModelClass target,
                        Signal signal)
        Asynchronously sends the specified signal to the specified target object.

        Does not check whether the target object is deleted, it is only checked when the signal arrives to the target object.

        Parameters:
        target - the model object which will receive the signal
        signal - the signal object to send
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if target is null

      • If

        public static void If(Condition cond,
                      BlockBody thenBody,
                      BlockBody elseBody)
        An if statement of the model. As using Java if statements are completely forbidden in the model, this method should be called instead.

        Example: 

         
        ModelInt i = new ModelInt(-1);
        Action.If( ()  -> i.isEqual(ModelInt.ZERO), ()  -> { 
                Action.log("i is zero");        
        }, ()  -> {
                Action.log("i is not zero");
        });
        Parameters:
        cond - the condition of the if statement
        thenBody - the block to be performed if the condition is evaluated to true
        elseBody - the block to be performed if the condition is evaluated to false
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
        See Also:
        ModelType, VariableType, If(Condition, BlockBody), While(Condition, BlockBody), For(ModelInt, ModelInt, ParameterizedBlockBody)

      • If

        public static void If(Condition cond,
                      BlockBody thenBody)
        Equals to calling Action.If(cond, thenBody, () -> {}).
        Parameters:
        cond - the condition of the if statement
        thenBody - the block to be performed if the condition is evaluated to true
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either parameter is null

      • While

        public static void While(Condition cond,
                         BlockBody body)
        A while statement of the model. As using Java while statements are completely forbidden in the model, this method should be called instead.

        Example: 

         
        VariableInt i = new VariableInt(10);
        Action.While( ()  -> i.get().isMore(ModelInt.ZERO), ()  -> { 
                Action.log("i is decreased by one");
                i.set(i.get().subtract(ModelInt.ONE));  
        });
        Parameters:
        cond - the condition of the while statement
        body - the block to be performed while the condition is evaluated to true
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
        See Also:
        ModelType, VariableType, If(Condition, BlockBody), If(Condition, BlockBody, BlockBody), For(ModelInt, ModelInt, ParameterizedBlockBody)

      • For

        public static <T extends ModelClass> void For(Collection<T> collection,
                                              ParameterizedBlockBody<T> body)
        A foreach statement of the model. As using Java for statements are completely forbidden in the model, this method should be called instead.

        This method is currently only available in the API, its use is not exported to EMF-UML2.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects inside the collection
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection on which this method will iterate
        body - the block to be performed on every element of the given collection
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
        See Also:
        ModelType, VariableType, While(Condition, BlockBody), If(Condition, BlockBody), If(Condition, BlockBody, BlockBody), For(ModelInt, ModelInt, ParameterizedBlockBody)

      • For

        public static void For(ModelInt begin,
                       ModelInt end,
                       ParameterizedBlockBody<ModelInt> body)
        A for statement of the model. As using Java for statements are completely forbidden in the model, this method should be called instead.

        Example: 

         
 Action.For( new ModelInt(1), new ModelInt(10), i  -> { 
        Action.If(()  -> i.isLessEqual(new ModelInt(5)), ()  -> {
                Action.log("showing this message five times");
        }, ()  -> {
                Action.log("showing this other message also five times");                                       
        });
 });
        Parameters:
        begin - the first integer value to iterate on
        end - the last integer value to iterate on
        body - the block to be performed in every iteration
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
        See Also:
        ModelType, VariableType, While(Condition, BlockBody), If(Condition, BlockBody), If(Condition, BlockBody, BlockBody)

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String message)
        Logs a message.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be logged
        See Also:
        ModelExecutor.Settings.setUserOutStream(PrintStream)

        public static void logError(java.lang.String message)
        Logs an error message.
        Parameters:
        message - the error message to logged
        See Also:
        ModelExecutor.Settings.setUserErrorStream(PrintStream)
